intro: Dombeya biumbellata var. villosistyla, commonly known as the silky dombeya, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a soft, velvety appearance. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its unique texture. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained, sunny conditions.
